description: landscape image of man in white fedora, standing with back to viewer, hands in pockets, in front of a line of barbed wire fence; in the distance is a large storm cloud and rainstorm over mountains
markings: embossed seal at BR corner margin: STUART D. KLIPPER / PHOTOGRAPHER
signed: verso across bottom, purple ink: EVAN DRAWING POWER, NORTHERN NEW MEXICO, 1989   STUART KLIPPER
text: The histories of those who work on behalf of museums are usually found within archival materials. In this case, the photographer Stuart D. Klipper made this portrait of Evan Maurer, who served as Mia’s director for sixteen years, while he was traveling in New Mexico for work. Klipper’s elongated horizontal composition emphasizes the expanse and openness of New Mexico’s landscape, and is potentially a nod to the photographer’s admiration of his Maurer’s work.
title: Evan drawing power, Northern New Mexico
